name: Hyacinth Macaw
description: The Hyacinth Macaw is the largest parrot species, recognized for its vibrant blue feathers and yellow eye patches.
spread_note: Found primarily in Brazil, Bolivia, and Paraguay.
food_note: Specialized beak allows them to crack hard nuts with ease.
proportions: Length: up to 100 cm, wingspan: up to 140 cm, weight: 1.2-1.7 kg.
reproduction: Monogamous, lays 1-2 eggs in tree cavities, incubation about 29 days.
attractions: A highlight in zoos due to their size and striking color.
projects_note: Endangered due to habitat loss and pet trade; conservation programs are active.
breeding: Breeding in captivity is challenging but successful in some programs.
